alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 19 at 3:01AM AKST until November 21 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile through Thompson Pass. For Keystone Canyon and Valdez, blowing snow with visibility reduced to one half mile at times. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass * WHEN...From Monday morning through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...No additional snow is expected during this event. Reduced visibilities will be caused by winds lifting and blowing transportable snow already on the ground.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very hazardous.
